{"title":"page 20","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"be held accountable for their good conduct and
efficiency.
Sec. 4. The Lieutenant of each District shall
invariably remain in charge of the main Police
Station House of the District in which he may be
stationed. (It is understood that the main Station is the one in the immediate vicinity of th.
respective Recorder's Courts.)
Sec. 5. Such arrangements shall be made that
the Lieutenant or one of his Sergeants shall, it
practicable, see each man composing the Police
force of the District, who may be on night duty,
at least once during the night.
Sec. 6. The Roll at each Station shall be called
at such hours as the Chief of Police shall direct,
and the Lieutenant will cause the men as their
names are called for duty, to arrange themselves
in line in order that they may be inspected, and
that all negligence in attire, want of cleanliness or
unfitness for duty, from any cause may be reported.
Sec. 7. He shall receive into his custody and
safely keep every person apprehended for any
criminal offence whatever.—(See Sec. 15, General Rules.)","fullrs":{},"find":"2659.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"2658","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"469807","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.45 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
